input:
Context: 'I would need 2 out of 3 as well.' 'Interesting - you're essentially saying that you need the majority of two of the three items. Hmm...' 'Yes, thats all. I need 1/3 food, 2/3 water, and 2/3 firewood.'
Utterance: 'Still not convinced in any way that you need more items in total over me. Please clarify!'

Context: 'Yeah I need firewood too. It's only 50 degrees at night on the mountain, even in the summer.' 'How would you feel about giving me some firewood for food?' 'Maybe, I need food too but I want firewood the most.'
Utterance: 'Do you have a deal to offer?'

Context: 'Same here! We had a couple bumps in the road though, as our freezer stopped working so all our food went bad ☹️' 'That is rough ☹️  We should try to split the resources equitably then' 'Ya definitely. I need food and firewood most. What do you need?'
Utterance: 'I believe that we have the same priorities.  So we have a large family including children that need the food, but my wife also needs firewood due to poor circulation.  She is susceptible to frost bite and limb loss'

Context: 'Looking forward to the trip.  They gave up the bare essentials but I could really use some extra supplies.🙂' 'I could too, I am a little short on a few things!'
Utterance: 'My biggest concern is water.  I could really use more.  That and some extra food.'

Context: 'Oh ok, that will be great. How about the water? Is 2 for me and 1 for you ok?' 'How about 2 for me 🙂' 'I have 3 kids with me who are always thirsty but we can negotiate for it'
Utterance: 'Ok. Thats fine'

Context: 'Oh, well that's really nice of you. What do you propose?' 'You'll get 3 food and 2 water, and I'll take 3 firewood and 1 water. 🙂' 'Hmm, I think that could definitely work! Appreciate it 🙂'
Utterance: 'Sound great 🙂'

Context: 'Well, if I have to catch fish to eat, I'll need the firewood to cook them.' 'ok, so what at I get 2 firewood and you get 1 so you can cook your fish.' 'I'll really need 2 firewood if we do this.'
Utterance: 'I need the firewood also because this campsite is bare and the little bit of wood I did have a raccoon came and stole it.☹️'

Context: 'but i can't give you 3 food and 3 firewood, thats 6 items vs the 3 water' 'Sure you can.  If you really want water the most, why would you care about the rest as much?😮' 'most does not mean i have to neglect the rest, anyways either a) I get 3 water, 2 food and 0 firewood or b) I get 1 water, 2 food and 2 firewood'
Utterance: 'That is simply unacceptable.'

Context: 'I am thinking I will want food most'
Utterance: 'Great! Food is not my priority but water and food is.'

Context: 'i understand friend. i need 2 pack of water and 3 pack of food and 2 pack of fire wood. can you please help me ' 'No way can you have everything, I will need 3 packs of firewood 2 backs of water then you can have all the food' 'i have sicked people and kids so i must need food water fire wood. please help me friend'
Utterance: 'I am sick and have a large family if we cant cooperate together we all get nothing'

Context: 'I also need the water, because it's not safe to drink from streams here.  ' 'You are right, my water is dirty also but I am willing to let you have all three water. I would rather eat, so I would like 2 food.' 'Well, if I have to catch fish to eat, I'll need the firewood to cook them.'
Utterance: 'ok, so what at I get 2 firewood and you get 1 so you can cook your fish.'

Context: 'Awesome - same, I also need a ton of food. Will firewood be of interest to you as well? I'll be happy to compensate in this way' 'Firewood is not overly interesting to me, but water is somewhat enticing.' 'Ok, great - I can give you all of my waters in exchange for a majority of the food and half of firewood'
Utterance: 'Half of firewood? There are 3 so one of us has to get more. I would need more of that. '

Context: 'so water, firewood and food for you, and water food and firewood for me. what do you suggest' 'I'm not much of a food fan knowing that without firewood you die of hypothermia if wet, one can survive without food/ with little food for months' 'so let's do this quick, how about 2 water for you, 1 water for me, 0 food for you, 3 food for me'
Utterance: 'good excellent choice'

Context: 'that's so kind of you! could I please have 3? which item do you really need, I can give you 3 of it' 'okk i want 3 pack of firewood , 1 pack of food and 1 pack of water' 'could i have 1 firewood, if you'd like 1 pack food?'
Utterance: 'ok i will give '

Context: 'I would like 2 firewood, and I don't care about anything else. I would give you 2 water and 3 food' 'I will give you 1 firewood for 3 waters and 3 foods. ' 'Nah I'll pass'
Utterance: 'Do you have another deal to offer? ☹️'

Context: 'mind your words mr. i am in some trouble that's why i ask you this help. its not good man' 'Ok I am going to say this once before we both get nothing, I will get 3 Firewood, 2 Water and 0 Food. You will get 3 Food, 1 Water' 'i am also need firewood friend because we are going to snow fall place so i need at least 1 pack of fire wood '
Utterance: 'wait friend  i need fire wood must. how we all are live in the place please understand my situation '

Context: 'Okay, maybe wwe can split the food and water somehow. I don't know how.🙂' 'Can i have 2 firewood, 2 food and 1 water' 'That can work. That seems like a good solution to the problem.🙂'
Utterance: 'Ok I hope you are okay with that. Please confirm!'

Context: 'i am already giving you all 3 food which i also need to eat' 'Would you be willing to trade a piece of firewood for an extra water bottle? That will save me some time from chopping down extra wood.' 'no, best i can offer is i get 3 firewood, 2 water and 1 food'
Utterance: 'No thanks.☹️'

Context: 'i need food the most since there will be my kids and I. I can give up my firewood for food' 'Okay, so how about I get 1 food, and 3 firewood and 1 water, and you get 2 food, 0 firewood, and 2 water' 'sounds great'
Utterance: 'great! sounds good to me'

Context: 'Hello! 🙂' 'I hello I need firewood to survive' 'oh my are you going somewhere cold? I could use the water, I am going on a charity event with kids from the Make A Wish foundation. Its going to be their first time!'
Utterance: 'Ok I will give you 3 waters if you give me 3 firewood'

Context: 'Yes, I expect that! You need food most and I need water, so let's propose an exact trade? 3 for 3?' 'My main objective for the camp is food and firewood, since I have a large family and the amount of food they give in the camp is very small for all my family and my wife and I have to cook with firewood in the camp.' 'I understand completely. I would like to have all three water, and I'm only traveling with just me, so how about 1 firewood? The rest for you.'
Utterance: 'No me gusta mucho el trato, pero para eso debemos hablar y decidir como adultos un buen trato para los dos. Lo que queremos es disfrutar en el campamento.'

Context: 'I have a medical condition that causes my veins to close up when I get too cold. I will thus need the 3 firewood.' '☹️Oh, that sounds awful. Are you sure you need all three packages of firewood?' 'I might be able to get by with just two... I'm on a diet though, so I don't need as much food.'
Utterance: 'That's a relief. I actually have a friend joining me and they don't have their own food supply. I don't have enough for two people.'

Context: 'Hey!  I hope you're having a good week and staying well.  So we are negotiating on supplies! 🙂' 'Yes. Hoping we can make a good deal.'
Utterance: 'Me too!  I'm hoping for two food items and one water.  I'm diabetic so if my blood sugar drops, I may need the extra carbs.  And water because water is important! 🙂 '

Context: 'Hello how are you today? 🙂 Do you have any initial ideas on how to split everything? ' 'I was thinking maybe I could have a majority of the fire food and you can have a majority of the water and food. ' 'What exactly do you mean by majority? As in everything ?'
Utterance: 'I was more thinking 2 Firewood for me , 1 food and 1 water? The rest would be yours.'

Context: 'So if I take 2 foods and 1 firewood, you take 1 food and 2 firewood. What would be fair for water?' 'What if I take two waters and you take one water then?' 'I think that sounds fair, since you compromised on food. Sounds like a deal!'
Utterance: 'I'm glad we could come to a compromise 🙂'

Context: 'My biggest concern is water.  I could really use more.  That and some extra food.' 'My biggest concern is food and then water. ' 'I'm going to need quite a bit more water, at least 2 packages.  I would like at least 1 food. What do you think?'
Utterance: 'How about you take two water and 1 food and 2 firewood?'

Context: 'Thats what I wanted, but wait , I just remember that I have to stay a bit longer at the camp . why don't you let me have 3 on food, 2 on firewood and you van have all the water and ' 'ok, your being greedy but lets make the deal' 'hahahah not too greedy, but yes we can make a deal🙂'
Utterance: 'you gave me one on each, thats unfair man!'

Context: 'Okay so we can think about splitting the firewood. 🙂 I'm also interested in water because I plan to do a lot of activities like hiking and kayaking, so it will be helpful for me to be able to hydrate more.' 'That is okay. What about i get 2 packages of firewood and then you get 2 packages of water. Is that okay with you?' 'Since I'm most interested in firewood, I would want 3 waters if you're going to get more firewood.'
Utterance: 'Nice. That's okay with me. You get 3 waters and a I get 3 firewood'

Context: 'I have 3 kids with me who are always thirsty but we can negotiate for it' 'Ok. Thats fine' 'Oh great 🙂'
Utterance: 'There is really not much option of evenness since its an odd number package.'

Context: 'Hello' 'Hi can I ask what camping supplies you most need?'
Utterance: 'I would like the 3 food packages because my sister forgot to pack any food items for the trip. You can have all the water and firewood. '

Context: 'I am okay with that 🙂' 'okay an for as the water two for me an 2 for you right? are you sure?' 'Yes, as long as I can get two of the food. '
Utterance: 'yes i'm okay with you getting two food packages and me one. '

Context: 'hello' 'Hi how are you?'
Utterance: 'I am good. How are You.   I was just thinking about how I need extra water due to a medical condition.  How about I take all 3 waters?'

Context: 'Thats a shame, i am sure you would like it if you give it a try, especially if you build a large fire 🙂' 'I was going to say, the fire would be probably one of the few things I would be interested in! I love being warm.' 'Well you can take all the firewood if it will help, would it be ok if i get all the food in return?'
Utterance: 'That works for me. How would you like to divide the water?'

Context: 'Can I get 3 packages of food?' 'What do you need it for?' 'I would like some extra food in case I get hungry.'
Utterance: 'Okay that sounds ok, I can do without the food. I also need two packages of water because it will be very hot out.'

Context: 'hi  i was wondering if i could get 3 packages of firewood?'
Utterance: 'Hey there, unfortunately, I'm in a bit of a quandary with firewood too, as I am going to a place where it's fairly cold and will need more for heat. '

Context: 
Utterance: 'I need the firewood and the food, you can have all the water.'

Context: 'Hello, How are you? My children love to eat and have fires daily. I hope this deal works for you.🙂'
Utterance: 'Hello, I'm fine. I understand your need. I have health issue I can't stand without food and water.I hope you will understand my situation.'

Context: 'so you want two firewoods and three waters and I get everything else? ' 'That sounds good to me!' 'I really need at least two firewoods to cook with though, or one water. How can we make this work?'
Utterance: 'I could give you two firewood, if I could still have my three waters and then 1 food.'

Context: 'I have a medical condition that causes my veins to close up when I get too cold. I will thus need the 3 firewood.' '☹️Oh, that sounds awful. Are you sure you need all three packages of firewood?'

I could give you 2 food and you give me an extra water?'
Utterance: 'unfortunately that doesnt work for me. i am afraid i will not be able to discuss this any further my final offer is i get 2water 2food and 1wood'

Context: 'Hey, I was thinking that I could take all of the food items, and 2 of the firewood items. My friend has low blood sugar and they need the food in case they crash, and the warmth of the fire to maintain at evening.' 'Water is my highest priority, what is yours? Is it food?' 'Yes, food is my highest. It's necessary for my friend to keep extra around just in case he crashes. Why is water your highest priority?'
Utterance: 'I need the water to drink - I don't trust the water I might find at the campsite.'

Context: 'Hi! How is your camping trip going?' 'It's going good we could use some more supplies such as food and firewood, though.'

Context: 'you can make water by boiling water with all that extra firewood you got' 'you said I could have some firewood' 'Let me take 2 firewood, 2 water and you take the rest. You will have more than me overall'

Context: 'Ok, but I need at least 1 package of water. So, I can give you 2 packages of water along with the 1 package of firewood and the 3 packages of food. Do we have a deal?🙂' 'So i get 1 firewood, 2 water and 3 food?' 'Yes, do we have a deal?'
Utterance: 'Yeah, we have a deal. Thank you '

Context: 'I'll give you one of the extra food so you have a little extra to cook for everyone but I'm really gonna need all that extra water, it's going to be really hot this weekend and the folks at the capsite get to sit in the shade all day' 'Now we are making progress. But come on, I will need at least one water to make sure I'm hydrated. I wouldn't want to get heatstroke out in the woods.' 'The basic supplies include water, the additional supplies are just extra. Plus I think there's a well nearby!'
Utterance: 'Bro, come on. I've tried to accomodate your needs, but you are asking for too much.'

Context: 'I really need the water more than the rest of that stuff. I'll take 2 waters, 1 food, and 1 firewood. ' 'We close the deal if I drink 1 water, 2 meals, and 3 firewood' 'Give me just 1 firewood, and we'll have a deal'
Utterance: 'We have a deal'

Context: 'Try to understand our situation. We had food a week back. We were drinking only water for the whole week. We are dying of hunger. Kindly understand our situation.' 'Even me too facing the same, but i am ready to share one food with you. You can offer me more water to safe myself without dying. Both will be happy' 'Okay I shall give you 1 package of food and 2 packages of water. Is that okay for you now?'

I have health issue I can't stand without food and water.I hope you will understand my situation.' 'I completely understand where you are coming from. How much food do you need?'
Utterance: 'I need at least 2 package of food and 3 package of water. Please do favor for me.'

Context: 'Cool! 🙂  It's a good number, we are planning on 10, but you never know on these.  What I do know is this group loves to eat and hike, plus it might get a little chilly.' 'yeah, i understand that. we are all apart of a weigh watchers group ao we' '😮 Been there and done that.  It's great when you can start to see the change in their self esteem!'
Utterance: 'yes, for sure starting to see results, id be more than happy if i could get two or three waters and at least one or two firewood '

Context: 'Thank you for asking, I would really like some extra fire wood as I usually get cold and scared at night so I can keep a fire going.' 'I'd be willing to give you all my firewood if you could give me all the water.' 'I do need at least one extra water bottle in case the fire goes out of control, but I am willing to forgo any food as I can forage for food.'
Utterance: 'Alright. Thanks. I only ask for so much of the water because I am overweight and I know while camping I'll work up a huge sweat.'

Context: 'Do you have food? I have been trying to hunt but have not really found any animals nearby to hunt.' 'I do actually!  I can give you 3 foods. Would that work?' 'Sure, I can do that.'
Utterance: 'So if I give you 3 woods, can you give me 3 firewoods and 2 waters?'

Context: 'Thank you, it would have been difficult for me to get more firewood and I appreciate the additional water. So I get 3 firewood, 2 water and 0 food.' 'Yes, I think that deal will be the most helpful to both of us. I appreciate the food, which is important to me.' 'You are welcome. Thank you for being so understanding, the extra packages are really going to come in handy for me!🙂'
Utterance: 'Perfect, I will submit the deal after just a few more messages. You were great to work with!'

Context: 'Actually, I'd like to keep some water as well in case it gets so cold that the lakes and other water sources freeze.' 'Well, I need as much food as possible. You seem to want firewood. How about you suggest something.' 'That's a good idea.Let me think. How about 3 Firewood, 1 Food and 2 waters for me.'
Utterance: 'That will not work for me at all. '

Context: 'Hello, how are you?' 'Hello, I am doing well, I am excited about my upcoming camping trip, how are you ?'
Utterance: 'I good thank you.  Yes, I am excited about this trip but I have been worrying about how I can get more firewood.  A raccoon came and stole mine this morning from the campsite.  So would it be alright if I kept all 3 firewoods?'

Context: 'Hello I need a lot of water to survive'
Utterance: 'I have a lot of water around me I can use. So I can give you a lot of extra.'

Context: 'I'm doing pretty good. I plan on camping with the family this weekend, how about you?' 'Nice. Same, it's over 100 degrees where I live. 🙂' 'Yikes! It's a bit colder up here, that's why I would like to bring some extra firewood to stay warm at night.'
Utterance: 'Oh, I see what you did there. No problem I have plenty of firewood for you buddy. 🙂'

Context: 'Hello. I'm looking forward to striking a deal with you that makes both of us happy!' 'Sure I am waiting too!'

' 'I think I can help with that, but in exchange, can I have 3 firewood bundles? I hate to take from the forest and risk damaging the natural wildlife habitat.' 'yes of course!'

I have a rather large family so there is more of a need. ' 'Can I have 2 of firewood in that case, as I have food that needs to be cooked and would be a great help.'

'Well that is not going to work well for my family of 8 now is it? Haha. I think we can come to some sort of agreement though.🙂'

Context: 'Yes, I get cold easy. Thanks a lot!' 'sure, i have a lot of people coming thats why i need food' 'No problems with that. I am glad we could make a deal. To summarize, you will have 3 of food and 1 of firewood while I will have 3 of water and 2 of Firewood.'

Context: 'Hi there.  That hardly leaves me with anything and doesn't really work for me.  I was hoping to make a campsite feast and get the extra food.  If we can do that, I'd be happy to give you all the water and that extra firewood.' 'I am a big guy, so I will need some more food, how about you give me an extra food while you hold on to two' 'I can't give you all the water if you take one of the food, I'm very sorry.  I could take 2 of the food and 2 of the water if we do it that way.  I really need cooking supplies if I want this trip to be productive for me - it's why I was coming.'

And it's pretty important, lol ' 'It sure is..So how much food do you need for the trip? Do you need firewood to cook the food? Thank you for understanding my issues. 🙂'
